items.text: full and down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, 1 wide

items.text: full and in at middle stump, driven to mid-on off the inside half
items.postText: meMemnon: "MAN!! How important SHAKIB for Bangladesh is! It is clearly visible now that they have taken an allrounder in Saifuddin to replace him, but had to include one extra batsman for covering the hole SHAK left and the result is one frontline bowler still short! "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length on off stump, tapped down the pitch off the back foot
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: short of a length at off stump, cramps him. No option but to punch this to mid-off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length and in at middle stump, nudged to mid-on with the angle
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: nicely timed, but mid-off backs the bowler's discipline. Length outside off and he gets nice connection on this back foot punch. Won't beat Liton's dive to the right
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length on middle stump, flicked straight to mid-on off the front foot
items.postText: Andy: "Nicholls needs to get better at strike rotation. Has a tendency to be a bit block or bash. "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.preText: Here is Mustafizur. Wide slip and and a fine backward point, as per usual
items.text: length at leg stump, shuffles and clips it deftly to deep square's left
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, 2 runs

items.text: 134kph, short of a length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: 135.4kph, short of a length on leg stump, clipped straight to midwicket
items.postText: Sakib: "@meMemnon absolutely. And to think Mehedy had the capability to be groomed as a replacement/supplement to Shakaib as a genuine all rounder. But he has also not been given that expoure."
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: 119kph, short of a length offcutter, from leg stump. Defended into the off side
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: length on middle stump, poked to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
items.postText: CJ: "@Brendan, if it was a batting pitch wouldn't you want Neesham over Munro? You would rely on the top order to score runs and an extra bowler would give more options as it's easier for the opposition to bat too."
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: length on middle stump. Another offcutter. Defended into the off side on the front foot
items.postText: Imam: "Saifuddin is a more than handy 6th bowler and a decent batsman. In no way he should be picked ahead of Rubel who is always a wicket taking threat. You don't win games with 3 frontline bowlers. "
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: full and in at middle stump. Looks to drive through cover, gets it to midwicket off the inside half
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, 1 run

items.text: length on leg stump, clipped to deep backward square
items.postText: Brendan J: "@Andy: Nicholls, block or bash? Just over a third of his career ODI runs are in boundaries.. " --- I suppose the argument here is that he's a compact, organised player who is playing the merit of the ball, which is not always optimal in Powerplays
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Guptill, 1 run

items.text: length on off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length at the stumps, nudged into the leg side
items.postText: nathan : "exactly @ brendan j thats what Andy means he either hits boundary or blocks, he needs to think more about the ones and twos "
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, no run

items.text: length on off stump, tapped on the up to mid-off
items.postText: james: "To Saifuddin's credit, he bowled exceptionally well throughout the BPL, with some very good death bowling as well. He's definitely improved since the days where he got hit for a myriad sixes in an over, but I agree that BD should've also had Rubel in the XI. Its not as if Sabbir has provided any use here at all."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Nicholls, 1 run

items.text: 136kph, short outside off. Springs into it with a pull, but can't get it past midwicket
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, no run

items.text: lovely. The bad ball he's been waiting for. A bit too full from Fizz, and angled in towards leg stump. He gets his weight into the and punches it past Guptill
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, FOUR runs

items.text: slower ball at a length outside off. Inside-edge onto pad as he gets forward.  Confident call from Guptill to steal a single from point
items.postText: Jimit: "Good batting from New Zealand. Have learnt the lesson of not losing wickets in the powerplay. Nicholls is slow, but he is creating a good platform from where to launch."
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Nicholls, 1 run

items.text: short of a length offcutter on middle stump, defended off the back foot
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: offcutter at a length on middle stump. Defended to cover point on the front foot
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, no run

items.text: short of a length on leg stump, climbs on top of it and tucks it to deep square
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, 1 run
